solution.text:
Assuming x as the initial price.
Discount percentage = 20%
Therefore, final price = initial price - (initial price x (discount percentage/100))
_{{j*40}}_ = \(x\) - (20\(x\)/100)
_{{j*40}}_ = 80\(x\)/100
\(x\)= (100 x _{{40*j}}_)/80
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore, \(x\)= Rs. _{{j*50}}_

content.text: Meena bought a pair of socks for Rs. _{{j*40}}_. The store said the discount rate was 20 %. What were the initial price of the socks?
